summary: This document is an email chain from January 2021 regarding the technical upload and replacement of a data set related to the case 'US v. Epstein' into a Relativity review platform. The correspondence involves coordination between a legal team and a vendor (Melken Solutions) to provide access to documents, specifically mentioning the replacement of 'Florida scanned data' with a new data set.

persons.name: CFO & Director of Operations Melken Solutions, LLC
persons.context: The individual, whose specific name is not provided, is the CFO & Director of Operations at Melken Solutions, LLC, the vendor responsible for handling and uploading the case data to a secure portal.

events.title: Data Portal Access Shared
events.description: The vendor (Melken Solutions) shares access to a folder named 'SDNY' containing uploaded data for the case via a ShareFile portal.
personsInvolved: CFO & Director of Operations Melken Solutions, LLC

events.title: Decision to Replace Florida Data
events.description: Confirmation is given to remove the existing 'Florida scanned data' from the Relativity platform and replace it with a new data set provided by the vendor.
personsInvolved: CFO & Director of Operations Melken Solutions, LLC

events.title: Vendor Processing New Data Upload
events.description: The vendor confirms they have the new data set and are working on uploading it to Relativity after removing the old data, with the legal team awaiting access to start review.
personsInvolved: CFO & Director of Operations Melken Solutions, LLC

keyFacts: The correspondence is specifically about the case 'US v. Epstein' and involves managing document discovery data.
A vendor, Melken Solutions, LLC, is handling the technical upload of case data to a Relativity review platform for legal team access.
There is a specific mention of replacing 'Florida scanned data' with a new data set, indicating the case involves documents from Florida.
The communication highlights the use of secure file-sharing tools (ShareFile) for transferring sensitive legal case materials.
The email chain shows an active legal review process for the Epstein case was ongoing as of January 2021.
